perturbation.original_text: 1.27 Maintenance Services - the services described in SCHEDULE D or in any Product License Schedule or Order with respect to any Licensed Program including telephone consultation, online and on-site technical support, Error correction and the provision of Updates.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.27 Maintenance Services - the services described in SCHEDULE D or in any Product License Schedule or Order with respect to any Licensed Program including telephone consultation, online and on-site technical support, Error reporting and the provision of Updates.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition mentions 'Error correction' as part of maintenance services. The changed text replaces this with 'Error reporting.' This creates a contradiction: does the Supplier correct errors, or only report them?

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 Supplier shall provide the Maintenance Services attached hereto as SCHEDULE D.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 Supplier may provide the Maintenance Services attached hereto as SCHEDULE D.
perturbation.explanation: The original text makes the provision of Maintenance Services mandatory ('shall'). The revised text makes it optional ('may'), creating an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: D. Supplier shall deliver to Bank of America and keep current a list of persons and telephone numbers ("Calling List") for Bank of America to contact in order to obtain answers to questions about the Equipment or to obtain Corrections. The Calling List shall include (1) the first person to contact if a question arises or problem occurs and (2) the persons in successively more responsible or qualified positions to provide the answer or assistance desired. If Supplier does not respond promptly to any request by Bank of America for telephone consultative service, then Bank of America may attempt to contact the next more responsible or qualified person on the Calling List until contact is made and a designated person responds to the call.
perturbation.changed_text: D. Supplier shall deliver to Bank of America and keep current a list of persons and telephone numbers ("Calling List") for Bank of America to contact in order to obtain answers to questions about the Equipment or to obtain Additional information. The Calling List shall include (1) the first person to contact if a question arises or problem occurs and (2) the persons in successively more responsible or qualified positions to provide the answer or assistance desired. If Supplier does not respond promptly to any request by Bank of America for telephone consultative service, then Bank of America is solely responsible to contact the next more responsible or qualified person on the Calling List until contact is made and a designated person responds to the call.
perturbation.explanation: The original text enforces the supplier responsibility to provide Bank of America consultative service, whereas the modified version puts the bank as the sole responsibilty in case the supplier does not respond promptly
